meanings.definition: A type of fungus that typically has a woody fruiting body with pores on the underside.
meanings.sent1: The forest floor was covered with polypores, each one displaying its unique pores.
meanings.sent2: Hikers often come across polypores while exploring wooded areas.
meanings.sent3: The polypores seemed to be having a party, showing off their pores to each other.
meanings.sent4: The polypores worked together like a team of tiny wood decomposers.
meanings.sent5: The polypores stood out like little wooden sponges in the forest.

meanings.definition: Fungi in the Polyporaceae family, known for their ability to decompose wood.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the polypores to understand their wood-decomposing abilities.
meanings.sent2: Foresters rely on polypores to help break down fallen trees in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The polypores threw a wood-decaying party, inviting all the other fungi.
meanings.sent4: The polypores worked tirelessly, turning fallen trees into fertile soil.
meanings.sent5: The polypores were like tiny wood recyclers, transforming old logs into nutrients for the forest.
